intro: Grandiphyllum divaricatum, commonly known as the variable legume, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, with multiple small leaflets, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The seeds are enclosed in slender, curved pods, which dry and split open to release the seeds.
